synopsis: A large-scale witch hunt was carried out in a particular kingdom. In the middle of the burning of one such witch, a child was born. Suddenly, a silver wolf appeared and saved the baby from the flames. Since then, much time has passed...

Even after seventeen years, the witch hunts continue. The goal is to eliminate all the protectors of the people. However, the people they protect can be consumed by darkness, fall to darkness, and consume others as well.

Unable to control his flames, León and his father go to meet Gael in order to retrieve an item that Germán had left with him long ago. Along with Garo, Anna had left the Madou Ring Zaruba to her son. They move forward, but a shadow follows behind.

León and Germán take yet another detour on their way to Valiante. This time, to a small village off the beaten path that shuns outsiders. While León and his father check the rumors of mysterious disappearances, they uncover another dark secret...

Two sisters who led very different lives and their sons who are connected by fate. During the night of the new moon, León's life is consumed by Madou Ring Zaruba while Alfonso learns of his bloodline as well as the state of his country.

León and his father have finally arrived in Santa Bard, but they must know the current situation before they raid the castle. As they are collecting information, they come across a blacksmith named Jordi and his adopted son Julio...

Bernardo chases after a lead by some innkeepers who mistakenly believe that León is Prince Alfonso. The two meet, fight, and León loses miserably. When he wakes up again, he has no idea where he is or even who he is...
Separated from León, Germán has his own misadventures once he is deceived by some bandits and stripped of all his possessions, including his clothes.

After learning his mother is the youngest sister of León's mother Anna, Alfonso trained under Rafael to become a Makai Knight in order to defeat the Horrors plaguing his kingdom. But Alfonso soon learns that must kill a powerful Horror in his final test.
Germán reminisces about his youth when he went by the name of Roberto, remembering his time with Anna and their friend Bernardo Dion.
When León fails to defeat Bernardo, he wants a rematch. But Bernardo, having sold his soul to Mendoza to settle things with Germán, soon becomes obsessed with winning once more.

León and Alfonso finally meet as the two join forces to face Mendoza. But during the confrontation against their mutual enemy, León's grudge causes him to lose control of the Garo armor, and Alfonso must take some drastic measures to stop him.
As his friends and family have no clue about his whereabouts León is rescued by a girl named Lara and starts living with her family.

Splitting his time between managing the Kingdom in his father's place and hunting down the Horrors, Alfonso, now donning the Garo Armor joins forces with Germán to unveil the mystery of a fortress which became a thieves' den.
At Santa Bard, the local craftsmen decide to create an armored suit inspired by the legend of the Knight of Light to protect the city, but they soon find that such feat is not easy as they believed.
The capital is visited by the famous doctor Fabian, who treats his patients free of charge, but little the citizens know of his true nature and intentions.

Alfonso and León meet again, and after making amends with the prince, León decides to keep living with Lara and her family. However, his peaceful days with her come to a tragic end when a massive Horror attacks them.
While mourning Lara's death, León is engulfed by the flames of his seal, but once conquering his hatred, he renews his conviction and confronts Alfonso to reclaim his armor and become Garo once more.

Still disturbed upon hearing that Mendoza is still alive, and Germán was assigned to assist him, León goes after Emma, who is recklessly pursuing the Horror that once was her husband and fellow Makai Priest Luciano.
Once reunited, León, Alfonso and Emma start investigating the castle looking for clues about Mendoza's whereabouts, unaware that he is closer that they could imagine.
Despite Germán's warnings, León and his friends still pursuit after Mendoza, and both father and son must settle their differences in a duel.
Once taking heed of Mendoza's master plan, Gérman takes the opportunity to betray him and make an opening for León and the others to infiltrate his hideout.
Despite León and the others' efforts, Mendoza manages to summon the massive Horror Anima, and all hope seems lost.
Mendoza absorbs Anima into his own body becoming a godlike immortal being and León makes one desperate, final stand to stop him.
